TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit SwitchCase extends System.Object

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to create an expression that represents a switch statement without a default case by using the <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.Expression.SwitchCase%2A> method.
[!CODE [System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionDev10#34](../CodeSnippet/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.linq.expressions.expressiondev10#34)]

Docs.summary: Gets the body of this case.
Docs.value: The <see cref="T:System.Linq.Expressions.Expression"> object that represents the body of the case block.

Docs.summary: Gets the values of this case. This case is selected for execution when the <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.SwitchExpression.SwitchValue%2A> matches any of these values.
Docs.value: The read-only collection of the values for this case block.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a <see cref="T:System.String"> that represents the current <xref:System.Object>.
Docs.returns: A <see cref="T:System.String"> that represents the current <xref:System.Object>.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Linq.Expressions.SwitchCase Update (System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Linq.Expressions.Expression> testValues, System.Linq.Expressions.Expression body);

.method public hidebysig instance class System.Linq.Expressions.SwitchCase Update(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class System.Linq.Expressions.Expression> testValues, class System.Linq.Expressions.Expression body) cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a new expression that is like this one, but using the supplied children. If all of the children are the same, it will return this expression.
Docs.returns: This expression if no children are changed or an expression with the updated children.
